title: Simon Cowell says Sharon Osborne 'always welcome back' on The X Factor
text:
Simon Cowell and Sharon Osborne famously fell out when he failed to sign her up to The X Factor.(Picture: WireImage)

Simon Cowell has claimed he would love to work with Sharon Osborne again after the pair ended their explosive feud

Sharon, 66, previously lashed out at Simon after he fired her from The X Factor.

But the music mogul, 59, has now alleged that they have now buried the hatchet and he hopes they will work together on one of his shows in the future.

‘I phoned her up the other day and said, “look, I’ll be honest with you. How could I criticise you for being mouthy when it’s the reason I hired you in the first place?” Sharon gets a bit carried away but deep down she’s got real affection for the shows,’ he said.

‘There will be other versions of these shows, I am sure, and she is always welcome back. If ever she had an issue, I’d be on a plane in five seconds, she’d do the same for me.’

Louis Walsh, Sharon Osbourne and Simon Cowell were the original judging panel (Picture: WireImage)

Speaking to The Mirror, he added: ‘I know that about her. There’s absolutely no bad blood at all and I like I said, when people think I’m annoyed with her, I’m not!

‘She’s a good friend and always will be.’

The pair have been through a lot together (Picture: Getty Images)

Sharon was first a judge on the show from 2004 to 2007 before making returns in 2013 and again from 2016 to 2017 but claimed she was sacked last year for being ‘too old’.

The talent show judge had been lined up for the 2018 series but – despite plans to have her appear as a fifth member of the panellist for the live shows – she released a statement shortly after the competition launched to say she’d decided she was no longer needed in the role.

Speaking of her reason for turning down a spot on The Masked Singer, she said: ‘I was signed on to do another show at the time. I was signed to go to England, and then Simon Cowell changed his mind and thought I was too old.

‘Simon goes, “She’s old. We need somebody young.” So if you want young, fire yourself and get rid of those man t**s.’

Late last year Sharon took another swipe at music mogul Simon – who appeared alongside Louis Tomlinson, Robbie Williams and Ayda Field on the panel – as she blamed the X Factor boss for the show’s ratings decline.

She said: ‘Unfortunately, not out of malice, but I am only saying this because Simon’s quote thinks it is funny, that the figures have dropped, and dropped and dropped through the course of the show.

‘I am not saying it was all me at all, but [it’s because of] his decision to change the show again and again and again.’
